entry.title: [RBX4/RBX6/RBX7/RBX8/BHS1/BHS4/BHS5/BHS6/BH7][Dedicated Servers] - Boot Firmware Maintenance
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jan 24, 10:00 - 10:59 UTC

Jan 23, 17:06 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 24/01/2024 10:00 UTC
End time : 24/01/2024 10:59 UTC
Service impact : This maintenance affect reboots to disk or in rescue mode for servers running very old hardware
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our servers, we will be changing the boot firmware of legacy boot servers in RBX4, RBX6, RBX7, RBX8 and BHS from SYSLINUX to iPXE.

entry.title: [RBX/SBG][Storage and Backups] - NAS HA maintenance notification
entry.content:
Jan 23, 15:10 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Cluster10817 was not made because we had a hardware problem and maintenance was postponed.

Jan 23, 13:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 11, 19:26 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 23/01/2024 13:00 UTC
End time : 23/01/2024 15:00 UTC
Service impact : Impacted services might experience some input/output freezes for storage equipment during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will perform an update on the storage servers hosting your data.
This version will improve certain security mechanisms, as well as some performance enhancements.
During the maintenance period, your data will remain available.

entry.title: [RBX3][Dedicated Servers] - Rack 45C08
entry.content:
Jan 23, 11:19 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 23/01/2024 09:29 UTC
End time : 23/01/2024 11:00 UTC
Service status: Services are working as they should be.
Root cause : It was due to a malfunction on a power supply.

Jan 23, 10:50 UTC
Identified - Update : Our teams are always on the action to provide you with services as quickly as possible.

Jan 23, 09:52 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 23/01/2024 09:29 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in the rack 45C08 are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
